monogr.title: A reporte of maister doctor Redmans answeres, to questions propounded him before his death : concernynge certaine poyntes of religion, now beyng with many in controuersye. Whervnto diuerse artycles be added, lately subscribed by Master Chedsey

div.head: ¶ The Printer to the Reader.
div.p:
BEcause I had harde sundrye and dysagreynge reportes of Mayster Doctor Redmans iudgemente, in certaine pointes of religion at the tyme of his death, & perceyued one daye in Master Secreatary Cecilles Chamber at the Courte, a paper briefly conteynyng the sayinges of Master Redman, with the handes of dyuers learned men, subscribed to testifye the truth therof. I besought him to haue the coppye for the satisfaction of many men, and to shewe me the truth of the testimony writtē, the paper it selfe he lent me wyllyngly, whyche (as he told me) he had in the counsel, of the Duke of Northumberlāde to whō the Kynges Maiestye delyuered it. And for the profe of the matter written, they whose names be subscribed had affirmed the same partly to him selfe, partly to others besyde the testimony of their own handes, thus hauinge the thynge in my handes & perceyuing dayly talke to encrease here vpon, I thought it conueniēt to imprint it for the satysfactyon of the more nomber. And making Master Cecil
pryuye of myne intent with the reasons that moued me, he gaue to me two other wrytinges, the one written by Mayster Doctor Wilkes & belongyng to Master Redmans matter, thother of certaine artycles subscribed by Master D. Chedsey of Oxford, a man of moch learning, and as it semeth yeldyng his affectiō to learnyng, which thing I thought not amisse to knytte togeather in one printe, reseruyng the iudgement of the whole to bee measured by charyte, which as Saynte Paule sayeth: thynketh not euyll, ioyeth not on wyckednesse, but ioyeth on truth and suffereth al thyngs. &c. In the stock wherof, god graunte al the professors of thy word, to plante, and grifte, the growyng of theyr knowledge, that it maye in the spreadyng of the bowes brynge forth good fruyte in, worckes lyke the stocke.

closer.dateline: At Londō the .xii. day of December. M.D.L.I.
